member.name: T:Orleans.TestingHost.TestCluster
member.summary: A host class for local testing with Orleans using in-process silos. Runs a Primary and optionally secondary silos in separate app domains, and client in the main app domain. Additional silos can also be started in-process on demand if required for particular test cases.
member.remarks: Make sure that your test project references your test grains and test grain interfaces projects, and has CopyLocal=True set on those references [which should be the default].

member.name: P:Orleans.TestingHost.TestCluster.Primary
member.summary: Primary silo handle, if applicable.
member.remarks: This handle is valid only when using Grain-based membership.

member.name: P:Orleans.TestingHost.TestCluster.SecondarySilos
member.summary: List of handles to the secondary silos.

member.name: P:Orleans.TestingHost.TestCluster.Silos
member.summary: Collection of all known silos.

member.name: P:Orleans.TestingHost.TestCluster.Options
member.summary: Options used to configure the test cluster.
member.remarks: This is the options you configured your test cluster with, or the default one. If the cluster is being configured via ClusterConfiguration, then this object may not reflect the true settings.

member.summary: The internal client interface.

member.summary: The client.

member.summary: The storage emulator process name. One way to enumerate running process names is Get-Process | Format-Table Id, ProcessName -autosize. If there were multiple storage emulator processes running, they would named WASTOR~1, WASTOR~2, ... WASTOR~n.
